alert.note: Alert for Crawford (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 16 at 9:02AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Crawford, northwestern Sebastian, eastern Sequoyah and northeastern Le Flore Counties through 945 AM CDT... At 901 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Short to near Sallisaw. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Fort Smith... Van Buren... Sallisaw... Cedarville... Alma... Barling... Pocola... Muldrow... Roland... Arkoma... Mulberry... Dyer... Gans... Moffett... Rudy... Brushy... Brushy Lake State Park... Fort Smith Regional Airport... Short... Figure Five... This includes the following highways, Interstate 40 in Arkansas between mile markers 0 and 20. Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 305 and 328. Interstate 540 between mile markers 1 and 14. Interstate 49 between mile markers 22 and 25. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 AM CDT for northwestern and west central Arkansas...and southeastern, northeastern and east central Oklahoma.
